story:
SYNOPSIS

A Man lives on a dangerous, desolate beach with his Coconut wife. Existing on the margins of civilization, both Man and Coconut experience excruciating physical and psychological pain. When Coconut rots, the Man is discovered and pulled back to civilization. A faceless office worker named Melissa, attracted to the Man's raw agony, pushes both to the brink of disaster and deliverance.

THE PRODUCTION

Rachel Hutt and Jessica Lewis are teaming up with a group of actors and designers to create an ensemble-driven, multi-location site-specific theatre event employing both outdoor and indoor space. The production will run in New York City for one week in July 2013. As one of the play's themes is finding meaning in objects discarded by society, the set and costumes will be constructed with recycled and abandoned materials.

The play, written at NYU's Dramatic Writing MFA program, has received, a number of staged readings (all with positive feedback) and now deserves the opportunity to become a fully-realized production. Our goal is to raise $3,500 to take the play from the page to the stage. 

WHAT YOUR DONATION WILL DO!

Your contribution will make Man and Coconut a reality. So far, the leadership team has acquired free rehearsal and build space and will utilize resources such as Materials for the Arts to obtain some free production materials. The connections through theatre colleagues and Fractured Atlas have helped during the beginning phases of this project. The production will not launch (be fully produced); however, without your support. 

Money raised from the Man and Coconut Indiegogo campaign will be used as follows: 

  • Set and costume supplies 

  • Car rental for load-in and load-out

  • Park permits

  • Volunteer accident insurance

  • Advertising

  • Stipends for a cast of seven actors and a design/management team of five


Please consider donating today. Your donation is tax-deductible, as our project is being fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas, a registered 501-C3 not-for-profit. Even if you can't make a donation today, please spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign and production.

story:
The Thesis Statement

WOLF IN THE MIRROR depicts a journey through temptations and cages to reach the freedom of self-knowing. Set in a surreal world, Impulse Theatre once again plumbs the storytelling abilities of movement and music in their newest full-length piece.



What Are We Doing?

Hello! We are Impulse Theatre, a Victoria, B.C. based theatrical company that specializes in highly visual and sincere work. We craft productions from numerous stimuli and inspirations and are not afraid to put ourselves directly on the line between genres. Our goal is to mount striking, alternative pieces of theatre on a professional scale, this means paying our artists, booking appropriate rehearsal and performance space and acquiring the materials necessary to realize our vision with the fullness that a healthy budget can muster.

Our campaign seeks to raise funds for our upcoming production, WOLF IN THE MIRROR, now entering its third stage of development. Initially developed through the Student Alternative Theatre Company at UVic, where it was awarded Best SATCo of 2011, it was then selected to continue its growth at the Firehall Arts Centre's BC BUD's Festival in May 2012. It has been in hibernation, but now the beast is stirring once again and, with your help, will be revealing itself to Victoria this June!

This is a major step for Impulse Theatre and a powerful piece for Victoria.

Think of a feature length, music video, in immersive 3D. No dialogue, but hear us out! Impulse Theatre enjoys exploring how compelling silence can be, how powerful music is and how much can be conveyed through movement and gesture alone. In the absence of text the audience will find the story in every shift of the lights and turn of the bodies.

As with many Impulse productions, WOLF will have elements of collective creation and choreography, with Barrett being the ultimate curator or guide. At Impulse, we think it's invaluable to have multiple minds and hearts working to develop a piece, bringing it towards something more full and rare-- a show made by many, for many.

We hope that audiences will give up conscious, immediate, analysis and give over to their… impulses, WAH-WAH! We hope that they will absorb what is before them, and we know that  impressions will be as unique as the individual. Draw whatever conclusions you will, you may walk away with one message or thirty. We are simply inviting you to dine on the visceral, visual and aural feast that is THE WOLF IN THE MIRROR.

Direction - Andrew Barrett

Set and Lights Designer - Paphavee Limkul

Costumes Designer - Halley Fulford

Assistant Costume Designer - Lulu Fulford

Stage Manager - Jessica P. Wong

CAST: Alyssa Bell, Lucas Hall, Gordon Hunter, Samantha Lynch, Mily Mumford, Kathleen O'Reilly, Emily Piggford, and Levi Schneider


The Where and The When

Metro Studio Theatre / Victoria, B.C., CANADA

    http://www.metrostudiotheatre.com


June 19, 2014 PWYC PREVIEW: 8pm (Regular priced advance sales)

June 20, 2014: OPENING 8pm

June 21, 2014: 2pm & 8pm

June 22, 2014 CLOSING: 2pm


Here's Why We Need Your Help

With the generous support of the BC Arts Council, Dance Victoria, Grindstone Cafe and more, and the revenue from Impulse Theatre's annual Cabaraiser, we are able to cover the costs of production. Such costs include our elaborate set by Paphavee Limkul, (a winner of the Vancouver International Dance Festival's Larisa Fayad Memorial Award for contribution to the project,) and the costumes for our 8 performers by Halley Fulford, as well as the rental of the Metro and rehearsal space.

The chief goal with our Indiegogo campaign, then, is to compensate our team for their time and talents. Artists deserve to enjoy not only the pleasure of creative expression, but the financial reward of sharing their remarkable skills. With WOLF, as with all our past productions, we are working with highly-educated and hard-working folks and we believe it is paramount to reaffirm that art and artists are deserving of pay. We all thank you deeply for your help with that, for your support in its every form.


EXPENSES:

Production: $3100

Rental: $3445

Marketing/Administration: $580

Artist Honorariums: $7000

Total: $14,125


REVENUE:

BC Arts Council: $4500

Corprorate Sponsorship: $1500

Indiegogo: $5500

Cabaraiser: $750

Projected Box Office: $1875

Total: $14,125


The Indiegogo campaign will allow us to guarantee that we have the security to focus our livelihood on the creation and presentation of our work. If the funds are not met, whatever we raise will aid us in making our goals. All fees received go directly to the artists involved in WOLF IN THE MIRROR.


Why Is This Piece Important?

We are making this play because of the many ideas we are craving to communicate. We chose this style for the vast opportunities of interpretation it presents through its surreal nature. We are having this campaign so that we can pay our artists.

We have met the challenge of producing work on a shoestring in the past with happy resourcefulness. However, with pickings being so slim for previous productions, all profits would generally go straight to the show’s material costs or towards the costs of the next production, leaving nothing behind to thank our creative team with. With over 15 productions under Impulse Theatre’s belt, it is time we enter a new and longed-for phase as a company. Impulse will always have teenage experimental years in its heart, happy to do free pop-up performances on a rock in the ocean or in a university campus fountain, but we want WOLF to be a benchmark production for Impulse, where we compensate the creative team appropriately for their contributions to the work. Not too outlandish, yeah?

You can get to know the artists you'll be aiding by checking our Meet The Artists Package in our uploaded files.

You can find download it right here: http://www.impulsetheatre.ca/artist-package.html.

Our Way Of Saying Thanks

By contributing $10 or more, we offer a number of wonderful opportunities to connect directly with the cast members, through collaborating with us on the work, joining us at the show or even dinner, or perhaps receiving a personalized Impulse show just for you!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't feeling down to contribute monetarily, we definitely understand. That fact that you made it all the way down this page is a gift to us in its own way! Please share our campaign with your own communities online or in person, and if you live in Victoria, please join us at the Metro Studio Theatre in June for something very, very special. 


ABOUT/FOLLOW Impulse:

Website: http://www.impulsetheatre.ca

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ImpulseTheatre

Twitter: https://twitter.com/impulse_theatre
story_txt:
The Thesis Statement
WOLF IN THE MIRROR depicts a journey through temptations and cages to reach the freedom of self-knowing. Set in a surreal world, Impulse Theatre once again plumbs the storytelling abilities of movement and music in their newest full-length piece.What Are We Doing?
Hello! We are Impulse Theatre, a Victoria, B.C. based theatrical company that specializes in highly visual and sincere work. We craft productions from numerous stimuli and inspirations and are not afraid to put ourselves directly on the line between genres. Our goal is to mount striking, alternative pieces of theatre on a 
professional scale, this means paying our artists, booking appropriate 
rehearsal and performance space and acquiring the materials necessary to
 realize our vision with the fullness that a healthy budget can muster.Our campaign seeks to raise funds for our upcoming production, WOLF IN THE MIRROR, now entering its third stage of development. Initially developed through the Student Alternative Theatre Company at UVic, where it was awarded Best SATCo of 2011, it was then selected to continue its growth at the Firehall Arts Centre's BC BUD's Festival in May 2012. It has been in hibernation, but now the beast is stirring once again and, with your help, will be revealing itself to Victoria this June!This is a major step for Impulse Theatre and a powerful piece for Victoria. Think of a feature length, music video, in immersive 3D. No dialogue, but hear us out! Impulse Theatre enjoys exploring how compelling silence can be, how powerful music is and how much can be conveyed through movement and gesture alone. In the absence of text the audience will find the story in every 
shift of the lights and turn of the bodies. As with many Impulse 
productions, WOLF will have elements of collective creation and 
choreography, with Barrett being the ultimate curator or guide. At Impulse, we think it's invaluable to have multiple minds and 
hearts working to develop a piece, bringing it towards something more full 
and rare-- a show made by many, for many.We hope that audiences will give up conscious, immediate, analysis and give over to their… impulses, WAH-WAH! We hope that they will absorb what is before them, and we know that  impressions will be as unique as the individual. Draw whatever conclusions you will, you may walk away with one message or thirty.  We are simply inviting you to dine on the visceral, visual and aural feast that is THE WOLF IN THE MIRROR.Direction - Andrew BarrettSet and Lights Designer - Paphavee LimkulCostumes Designer - Halley FulfordAssistant Costume Designer - Lulu FulfordStage Manager - Jessica P. WongCAST: Alyssa Bell, Lucas Hall, Gordon Hunter, Samantha Lynch, Mily Mumford, Kathleen O'Reilly, Emily Piggford, and Levi SchneiderThe Where and The When

We all thank you deeply for your help with that, for your support in its every form. story:
A MERMAIDS’ TALE Comes Ashore at The Triad Theatre, Off-Broadway in Manhattan

This is more than an entertaining and engaging family-friendly show with memorable music---children will also find the story cleverly woven with strong values and many positive and educational messages about tolerance, the help of friends, overcoming adversity, courage, and bullying. We need your help to complete the journey and support enjoyable theater that has clean fun and useful life lessons !!!

WHO WE ARE

Friends Always Creating Theatre, a not-for-profit Theatre Company founded by Jack Dyville and David Gillam Fuller whose combined experience in Theatre equals 80+ years are thrilled to announce the transfer of Mr. Dyville & John Stutte’s, ‘entertaining – fun filled’ Children’s musical which is perfect for All Ages (4-94). 

 

ABOUT THE PRODUCTION OF "A MERMAIDS' TALE"

The production has been ‘a work of love’, having been commissioned by the James Memorial Preservation Society of Williston North Dakota for a world premiere in July 2011 as part of the Library’s 100th Anniversary, From there, FACT scheduled the show for its Family Series last March produced at The Great Room in Brooklyn – that success led to yet another re-incarnation with a ‘new’ cast at Secret Theatre in Queens NY – and now the rest is History as they say… or will be with your help!!!

We've assembled the same Great Cast – ‘full of energy & talent’ to bring the show to The TRIAD THEATRE, 158 W. 72nd Street – OFF-BROADWAY, New York City!

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

The rent is covered – and, oh boy are we lucky! But, there are so many other things yet to be paid; so we’re raising money to pay for these necessary things to produce a show in an Off-Broadway theater: actors, musicians, public relations, advertising, lights, costumes, sets, and even an Original Cast Album.

"How can I help?" I hope that is what you are asking… so, Click "CLAIM THE PERK" at the bottom of the page and donate what you can! Because our project is fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas, your donations are tax deductible! We can't begin to thank you enough for your financial contributions. Our gratitude knows no boundaries. And to show you ‘the love’ we are offering many different perks for your generous donations.

And, after you Click ‘CLAIM THE PERK’ won’t you please add our website to your Favorites so you can follow the progress of this next Great New Family Show in NYC. Join us at www.FactTheatre.org and Like Us on Facebook at F.A.C.T. Friends Always Creating Theatre.

If you know anyone who is as passionate for Theatre and especially would like to help FACT bring their wonderful and magical show to families all across the Metropolitan community, tell them of our fundraising campaign. We can’t thank you enough!!!

 

ABOUT THE PLAYWRIGHT/PRODUCER

Jack Dyville has been called a ‘Jack-of-All-Theatrical-Trades’ and has been in the professional theatre for 44 years holding a B.A. in Theatre & Journalism from Texas Wesleyan University and an MFA in Directing from Texas Christian University with additional masters’ credits from United States International University of San Diego

He began as a dancer and his first job in NYC was in the Ballet Corps at the famed Radio City Music Hall followed by National tours and Broadway and Off-Broadway productions; “Hello Dolly”, “Cabaret”, “West Side Story”. “Light Lively & Yiddish”, “Yoshe Kalb”, “DuBarry Was A Lady” and “Movie Buff”.

With a love for writing, he began dabbling as a playwright in 1979 as a hobby and soon found his first youth musical, “A Country Christmas Carol” published with I.E. Clark. He is also represented with the I. E. Clark catalogue for Dramatic Publishing with “Those Magical Red Sneaks”, “Barabbas: Out of Darkness” and “Gulliver’s Travels: In the Land of Lilliput” Now his writing career is more than a hobby and he has more than 16 selected plays published and serves not only as Producer/Artistic Director for FACT but is one of the five resident playwrights.

 Though his work has been seen in many NYC Showcase and festival productions, this is his Off-Broadway debut as a Playwright! He hopes you will not only donate to the success of this show but come see it as well.

 

ABOUT THE MUSICAL DIRECTOR

Heather Edwards is a musician and actress. Originally from the San Francisco Bay Area, Heather currently lives in New York City. After graduating from Berklee College of Music in Boston, Massachusetts, she moved to Nashville, Tennessee and dabbled in many facets of the music industry. Since relocating to New York City, Heather has been working as a pianist/songwriter/recording artist who has performed with many types of bands - from funk and rock to jazz and country and playing a wide range of characters as an actor. Heather trained her whole life as a classical pianist and continues to perform in that genre as much as possible.

She started writing music at age eleven and continues to write and perform her own music as well as conduct, direct, and perform in musical theatre. Heather has released three CDs:  "To Be Continued", "Eclectic Energy" and "Go With The Flow".  She also has a classical CD project and a musical in the works.

Heather is a member of AFM Local 802 and Actors Equity Association, and had many roles in television, film, and theatre. 

 

MORE ABOUT THE PRODUCTION

A MERMAIDS' TALE, the exciting new musical by Jack Dyville & John Stutte comes to Shore in Manhattan, following successful engagements in Brooklyn & Queens.

OPENING SEPTEMBER 15, 2012 for an Open-End Run, playing Saturdays @ 3:00pm

On the fabulous stage of The Triad Theatre, 158 West 72nd Street.

Adapted from the L. Frank Baum novel, "The Sea Fairies" penned the year following his success with "The Wizard of Oz"., it is set on a School Auditorium stage.  The students of Mr. Cutler gather to give their book reports on their favorite character from the Baum novel. Leave it to the students to make these reports more Magical, more Alive... they decide to turn the simple reports into a MUSICAL like on the ever-popular TV series, "GLEE"!!!

Join Us, as Trot (VICKI OCEGUERA – “Honestly Abe”) and her Grandfather (MARC RACO) take an undersea adventure with the Mermaids! Reluctant at first, because they have always heard "no one ever saw a Mermaid and lived to tell the tale!" Experience the Mermaid Magic - Meet in person the hilarious King Anko, (KIMBERLY CUELLAR) the villainous Zog (CARL HSU), his slightly zany assistant Sacho (KYLE JAMES JOHNSON), an underwater Goldsmith (MS. CUELLAR) who saves the day with her street-wise, rap-style delivery, three Mermaid Princesses (the Optimist ASHLEY ARAN), the Pessimist  (KACEY CARDIN) & the Botanist (PAIGE MITCHELL) and the beautiful Queen Aquarine (KIMBERLY DINARO).

Directed & staged by Mr. Dyville,  Assistant Director Vicki Oceguera, Musical Direction by Heather Edwards, Associate Producer Marc Raco, Sets/Props by Rodrigo Bolanos. Standby/Understudies: DEBRA TOSCANO,  W. ROBERT EVANS, MEG MC WHORTER, ERIC PAGAN.
   
Lots of audience participation for the kids! Lots of FUN for everyone. Catchy Songs!! Beauty. Excitement. Magic.

You may purchase tickets securely online or by 24/7 ticket hotline at 1-800-838-3006. 

 

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT OF THIS WONDERFUL PROJECT!

story:
We need YOU!


Finally we are recording Self Indulgent Ballad and producing a ‘comedy’ music video to go with it. Please support this exciting project and receive exclusive perks and experiences!


Hey everyone,

Welcome to the Indiegogo page for Self Indulgent Ballad. Scott here, with a little update on what is happening with the song.


Self Indulgent Ballad was born about two years ago, whilst chatting side stage at the Queen’s Theatre (London) with Hadley Fraser. We got on to the subject of musical theatre albums and artistes that released them and we found that on the whole most albums contained all the classic ballads you’d expect and how funny it would be to just be refreshingly honest and call your album ‘Self Indulgent Ballad’...... An idea was born!!


Some years and many re-writes later I find myself here looking to you to help finish what we started. The success of the song lies solely with the fans and supporters who embraced it and it’s important for me to share this final chapter with my friends, family and fans who have supported me so far, so I’ve teamed up with Indiegogo for this exciting project.


Myself and co-composer, Steven Luke Walker, want the song and video to reach a professional level that equally both us and you are proud of. However this is only achievable with your help, so as a thank you we will be releasing the song direct to you guys first, along with tons of exclusives including signed artwork and experiences that we have put together especially for this project.


So how can you support us? Well firstly you can pre-order the song, which will be sent to you as soon as it’s ready (before the official release date!) via a digital download card. If you want a little bit more then you can also get your hands on strictly limited: signed artwork, tickets to the launch event (with the potential for a personal meet & greet), and even the opportunity to hang out in the studio as we record the song, or appear in the music video with array of west end leading performers.


The song has been arranged by the amazing Niall Bailey and we’re recording the song in October at Berry Street Studios with some incredible musicians and vocalists. We aim to film the music video in November and the 'Exclusive Launch Night' will take place some time in December. The song will then become available on itunes and digital download etc after the launch.


Your generous support will ensure we produce a song and video that introduces my writing and comedy to a new audience and I promise to keep you updated every step of the way with exclusive blogs, videos and photos.


I hope you'll love the finished song as much as I have loved writing it, don’t forget to pre-order the song, get hold of some launch tickets and maybe purchase one of the other perks on offer!


Most of all please, please, please… spread the word!


Love and best wishes,


Scott x
@scottgarnham

story:
"...these people are all so busy putting on an act they haven’t got time to be themselves." After The Dance by Terence Rattigan.

What We're Doing

Co-Op Theatre East and The Dirty Blondes, two avant-garde New York theater companies, are pairing up to present a brand new take on Terence Rattigan’s rarely performed play After the Dance.  The show will premiere in late April 2014 in Brooklyn. And we need your help to make it happen!

About The Production

This new immersive production of the British classic play will be an evening you will never forget.  Set at the home of a high living, hard drinking wealthy Brooklynite, After The Dance will take you on a journey of one man's fall from grace as he grapples with a life so heavy with irony that it is empty of any substance.  Follow the characters via live video feeds and active participation, and witness the debauchery and tragedy unfolding throughout the night. Part party, part play, this will be an evening of dancing, live music, sarcasm, custom cocktails, and Rattigans' prescient text. Too dark for the time it was originally written, we bring you this classic like you never seen it before.

Dates: April 24th-27th 2014

Venue: Loft Space in Gowanus Brooklyn

What We Need & What You Get

Theater in New York is expensive to produce, especially for young theater companies. We need your help to make this production happen.  Every dollar donated will help us out! Here’s exactly what the money will go towards:

  • Artist and Designer Fees: $1,800
  • Venue: $4,000
  • Production Cost (set, props, costumes, AV equipment ): $1,400
  • Marketing: $650

All donations are tax deductible!  And the fun perks you get for your contribution will help complete your Brooklyn look for the show!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Instagram your classic Brooklyn photos using #classyhipster
  • Follow @cooptheatreeast and @thedirtyblondes on twitter
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Buy tickets (available soon!)
  • Tell your friends

Who We Are

Co-Op Theatre East

Founded in Spring 2008 by three graduates of the Performance Studies graduate program at Tisch School of the Arts, NYU, Co-Op Theatre East produces socially minded performance that deals with the questions of today, the situations we find ourselves immersed in as New Yorkers, Americans, and world citizens at this moment. The staff & ensemble at COTE firmly believe that theatre can do something; not only do we hold Hamlet’s mirror up to nature, but we can use theatre as a means to make a positive impact in the world.

The Dirty Blondes

The Dirty Blondes was founded with a mission to develop beautiful and subversive new works of theater by fostering a community of diverse artists dedicated to creativity and collaboration. Founded in Brooklyn, The Dirty Blondes have presented sold-out works at The Collapsable Hole, The Bleecker Street Theater, and The Brick Theater.  Winners of Outstanding Lighting, Outstanding Direction, and Outstanding Production of a New Play for THE AMERICAN PLAY at The Planet Connections Theater Festivity (2012).  Productions by The Dirty Blondes have been declared “chilling, dark and bitingly funny”, and “stunning from the first moment to the last,” (Karen Tortara-Lee, The Happiest Medium).

The Production Team:

Producers: Robert Gonyo, Tamar Halevi, Ashley J. Jacobson, and Elizabeth Sarkady 

Director: Casey Cleverly

Script Supervisor: Ashley J. Jacobson

Creative Team + Cast yet to be announced! Stay tuned!
story_txt:
"...these people are all so busy putting on an act they haven’t got time to be themselves." After The Dance by Terence Rattigan.
What We're Doing
Co-Op Theatre East and The Dirty Blondes, two avant-garde New York theater companies, are pairing up to present a brand new take on Terence Rattigan’s rarely performed play After the Dance.  The show will premiere in late April 2014 in Brooklyn. And we need your help to make it happen!About The ProductionThis new immersive production of the British classic play will be an evening you will never forget.  Set at the home of a high living, hard drinking wealthy Brooklynite, After The Dance will take you on a journey of one man's fall from grace as he grapples with a life so heavy with irony that it is empty of any substance.  Follow the characters via live video feeds and active participation, and witness the debauchery and tragedy unfolding throughout the night. Part party, part play, this will be an evening of dancing, live music, sarcasm, custom cocktails, and Rattigans' prescient text. Too dark for the time it was originally written, we bring you this classic like you never seen it before.Dates: April 24th-27th 2014Venue: Loft Space in Gowanus BrooklynWhat We Need & What You GetTheater in New York is expensive to produce, especially for young theater companies. We need your help to make this production happen.  Every dollar donated will help us out! Here’s exactly what the money will go towards:

Artist and Designer Fees: $1,800


Venue: $4,000


Production Cost (set, props, costumes, AV equipment ): $1,400


Marketing: $650

All donations are tax deductible!  And the fun perks you get for your contribution will help complete your Brooklyn look for the show!Other Ways You Can Help
Instagram your classic Brooklyn photos using #classyhipster
Follow @cooptheatreeast and @thedirtyblondes on twitter
Like us on Facebook
Buy tickets (available soon!)
Tell your friends

story:
Η Ομάδα και η Καμπάνια μας

  • Η Ομάδα Θεάτρου Seveneleven είναι μία Αστική Μη Κερδοσκοπική Εταιρεία που ιδρύθηκε το 2013 από τους ηθοποιούς Νότη Παρασκευόπουλο και Κωνσταντίνα Μαλτέζου με σκοπό την παραγωγή θεατρικών παραστάσεων. Έως τώρα, η ομάδα μας έχει κάνει δύο παραγωγές και χρειαζόμαστε τη δική σας βοήθεια για την επόμενη. 
  • Ακόμη και 1€ μας βοηθάει πολύ, καθώς δεν υπάρχουν άλλοι οικονομικοί πόροι στήριξης της τρέχουσας παραγωγής. Αν και το κόστος παραγωγής έχει κρατηθεί σε πολύ χαμηλό επίπεδο, φροντίζουμε πάντοτε να προσφέρουμε ένα υψηλής ποιότητας και αισθητικής αποτέλεσμα στους θεατές μας. Έτσι, λοιπόν, συνεισφέροντας στην καμπάνια μας, βοηθάτε την ομάδα μας να συνεχίσει και να χτίσει ένα πιο ισχυρό κοινό.


Τι χρειαζόμαστε και τι προσφέρουμε

  • Τα χρήματα που θα μαζευτούν θα χρησιμοποιηθούν για να καλύψουν τα έξοδα της παραγωγής, όπως το ενοίκιο του θεάτρου, κοστούμια και σκηνικά αντικείμενα.
  • Για κάθε ποσό που μας προσφέρετε, υπάρχει το αντίστοιχο αντάλλαγμα που σκοπό έχει να σας φέρει σε επαφή με την ομάδα θεάτρου μας και τις παραγωγές της.
  • Σε περίπτωση που δεν φτάσουμε τον επιθυμητό στόχο, θα χρησιμοποιήσουμε το ποσό που έχει συλλεχθεί για την κάλυψη όσο το δυνατόν μεγαλύτερου μέρους της παραγωγής.


Εναλλακτικοί τρόποι στήριξης

Για όλους εσάς που θέλετε μα δεν μπορείτε να συνεισφέρετε οικονομικά, υπάρχουν κι άλλοι τρόποι για να στηρίξετε την προσπάθειά και την ομάδα μας:

  • Δημοσιεύστε (share) την καμπάνια μας στο προφίλ σας στο facebook ή οπουδήποτε εσείς πιστεύετε πως μπορεί να μας βοηθήσει.
  • Επισκεφτείτε την σελίδα της ομάδας μας στο facebook "Seven Eleven Theater Company" και πατήστε Like.
  • Γίνετε συνδρομητές (subscribe) στο κανάλι της ομάδας μας στο YouTube και δείτε τα βίντεο που έχουμε ανεβάσει.
  • Διαδώστε την καμπάνια μας!

Λίγα λόγια για το έργο

"Το Παιχνίδι του Έρωτα και της Τύχης" του Μαριβώ

Η όμορφη, νεαρή Σύλβια επιθυμώντας να μάθει περισσότερα για τον νεαρό που ο πατέρας της διάλεξε για σύζυγό της, αποφασίζει να αλλάξει θέση με την υπηρέτριά της όταν μαθαίνει πως έρχεται να την γνωρίσει. Δεν ξέρει όμως πως και ο νεαρός Δοράντης έχει επιλέξει να κάνει το ίδιο. Αυτό το παιχνίδι μεταμφιέσεων οδηγεί σε συναισθηματικά μπερδέματα και μια διαμάχη ανάμεσα στις τάξεις. Όπως αποδεικνύεται όμως, η καρδιά ακολουθεί πάντα το δικό της δρόμο.

Πρόκειται για ένα έργο ύμνο στον έρωτα, γραμμένο από έναν από τους μεγαλύτερους Γάλλους θεατρικούς συγγραφείς, τον Μαριβώ, οι κωμωδίες του οποίου - μετά από αυτές του Μολιέρου - είναι οι περισσότερο παιγμένες στο Γαλλικό Θέατρο.


====================================

Our Company & Our Campaign

  • Seveneleven Theater Company is a non-profit company, founded in 2013 by Greek actors Notis Paraskevopoulos and Konstantina Maltezou. So far there have been two productions and we need your help for our third one.
  • Even 1€ is very helpful for us, as we don't have any other resources to help us produce our play. Though we keep our budget low, we always offer a high quality, profesional result to our spectators. So, by contributing, you help us produce yet another play, build a stronger audience and last but not least keep us going on a very difficult field, that of a professional actor.


What We Need & What You Get

  • The funding will be used entirely to cover the production expenses such as the theater's rent, costumes & set items.
  • The perks we have listed for you will get you in touch with our theater company and it's productions. 
  • In case we don't reach our goal, we will use the raised funds to cover as much of the production expenses as we can.


Other Ways You Can Help

For all of you who want but can't contribute there are a couple of more ways to help our efforts and our theater company:

  • Share our campaign to your facebook profile or wherever you think it might be helpfull for us.
  • Go on and "Like" our facebook page "Seven Eleven Theater Company".
  • Subscribe to our YouTube channel and watch our videos.
  • Spread the word!


About The Play

Set on a countryside estate in 18th-century France, this stylish romantic comedy is as delightful as it is provocative.  The beautiful, young Silvia wants to know more about the man her father has chosen for her to marry, so she trades places with her maid when the handsome Dorante comes a-courting.  Little does she know that her intended has similar concerns. Mistaken identity leads to class conflicts and emotional confusion as Marivaux demonstrates - with wit and charm - that the heart has a mind of its own.

story:
What is Liliom?

A love story that has transfixed audiences for nearly a century, Liliom inspired the legendary musical Carousel. The story of a servant-girl and the rough and gruff carousel barker she weds, Liliom is an extraordinary work about the limits of love and the prices we pay for it.

For the first time in over 40 years, Molnar's play returns to New York City in a brand new production from Beautiful Soup Theater.

Our performance schedule will be announced at a later time, but we are aiming for a late February, 2014 bow.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise funds to cover the costs of producing such a legendary play. The turn-of-the-century costumes alone will cost a pretty penny, and we'll need to rent many items from costume warehouses. In addition, the props to create the world of Muskat's Carousel will be a daunting cast. But what we'll produce is a memorable production of a beautiful play that has inspired and touched audiences for nearly 100 years.

Be sure to check out the perks on the right side of your screen. We've got lots of exciting offers to say "thanks" for your support!

The Impact

Nowadays, Rodgers and Hammerstein's Carousel is produced nearly 10x as often as Molnar's Liliom. While the two entities are much more different than you'd imagine, Hammerstein found great success in adapting such a dark and painful piece of theatre for the musical stage. With your help, we can remind audiences of the play that inspired one of Broadway's most important musicals.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? We understand. We get tons of requests to help with other campaigns and we often just can't give to everyone that we want to! But there are other things you can do to help us:

-spread the word about our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and more
-e-mail friends and family who can donate and encourage them to support our project
-buy tickets to the production when they are placed on sale

story:
Runaway is a new contemporary musical based on the classic fable, Peter Pan by Pulp Free Productions*. It tells the story of Emma Dear a young woman struggling to come to terms with her future as she gets whisked away into a contemporary Neverland full of sex, sin, and a mysterious powder called Flight. 

Runaway is directed by the librettist Kaleb Tank, with  score and music direction by Guy Connolly and Liam Hughes, with additional songs by Kenzie Bolte, and technical direction by Evangeline Read. 

Runaway is an ambitious production which will perform at the Jester's Dinner Theatre July 18th, 19th, and 20th. We will donate all its profit to their performing arts scholarship fund. After that Runaway will perform at the Altona Grange, August 1st, 2nd, and 3rd. 

Our budget is limited. We need lots of help to make this great production an even greater production. All our money will go towards renting out the Altona Grange, sets, costumes, and props.  Any contribution is greatly appreciated!

*Pulp Free Productions is a student run theatre organization whose quest it to produce at least one original piece of musical theatre per year.

story:
THANK YOU!
"I want to personally thank everyone who is a contributor to the Maggie Vaults Over the Moon audiobook campaign. I am so honored to be a part of this effort, and moved by the support of the project. Whether you contribute $5 or $500, you're a true partner in this labor of love." -- Tavia Gilbert

"Maggie on audiobook is going to be awesome thanks to all of you who stepped up with pledges! And thanks our great sponsors, Dial Athletics, Phillip Carrero, Fuzion Athletics, Gill Athletics, Raise the Bar Pole Vault Club, Shealy Athletics, Tailwind Pole Vault Club, and TexasPoleVault at Elite Sportz! Because of your generous support, Maggie's story will be heard!" -- Grant Overstake

About 'Maggie Vaults Over the Moon'

Maggie Steele is a gritty farm girl from tiny Grain Valley, Kansas who pours her broken heart into the daring sport of pole-vaulting. Her determined struggle to triumph over gravity is a compelling quest that everyone can relate to.

“I myself experienced loss when I was a young girl. Sports were my outlet and helped me through some of the hardest times of my life. This book captured me cover to cover. I highly recommend Maggie Vaults Over the Moon.” -- Becky Holliday, US Olympic Pole-Vaulter.

Reviewers are cheering for Maggie!



Family Friendly Listening

"Maggie has a tragedy without being gruesome, a love story that is innocent, and competitors that exhibit true sportsmanship. It is truly refreshing. The world needs more Maggies!" -- Jolene Frook, Sports Mom

Journey to the Heartland

“Overstake gets everything right about Kansas. It's sweet to read about a land I know so well.” -- Diane Wahto, Kansas Poet

Awaken hopes and dreams



“The positive influence this book can have on young athletes is invaluable. I am thrilled to have my athletes read it and be energized by its positive message.”  -- Erica Bartolina, US Olympian, Coach of Champions

Meet Tavia Gilbert

Tavia Gilbert (SAG-AFTRA) is an award-winning narrator with more than 250 audiobooks under her belt. Classically trained in voice and theater, Tavia attended the University of Washington and earned her Bachelor of Fine Arts in Original Works in Acting from Cornish College of the Arts and an MFA in Creative Non-Fiction from Vermont College of Fine Arts. Also a producer, Tavia has a clear understanding of the business side of her world. Her clients hire her again and again, recognizing her exceptional work and the advantage they have in someone with both a creative and business mind. Tavia resides in Brooklyn, New York.

"My intention is to manifest opportunities to develop deep relationships and tell stories that enlighten, uplift, inspire, entertain, move, comfort, motivate, educate, and encourage transformation." -- Tavia Gilbert

Meet Grant Overstake

Grant Overstake studied journalism at the University of Kansas and was a decathlete on the KU track team. He began sports writing at age 18 at The Wichita Eagle and later wrote for The Miami Herald. Grant returned home to edit rural newspapers, becoming one of the Sunflower State's most honored journalists. His premier novel, Maggie Vaults Over the Moon, was released in 2012 by his indie-publishing company, Go Team! Enterprises. His second novel, The Things We Put Away, will appear in 2014. In addition to writing and publishing, Grant facilitates creativity workshops. Grant and his wife, Claire, reside in Wichita. 

“My vision is that after hearing Tavia tell Maggie's story, a youngster will say: ‘If Maggie can do it, then why can't I? Today, I’m going to try!’” -- Grant Overstake

Pick a support level, Enjoy your reward!

$10

Join Maggie's Fan Club.
Thank you! Thank you!


$25

Maggie Vaults Over the Moon on Audiobook

Share the journey as storyteller Tavia Gilbert reads Maggie. Digital download.


$50

Cover Art by Phillip Carrero

Enjoy a high-quality poster of Maggie's new cover by Australia's Phillip Carrero, the world's foremost painter of this beautiful sport. Audiobook.


$125 [CLAIMED!]

Vault Pole Bag from Fuzion Athletics

This is truly a pole vaulter's pole bag, designed and made in the US by vaulters who've tried the other bags that just don't work. These rugged vinyl bags are about 8 inches in diameter and large enough to fit around a 6-inch corrugated tube. Choice of 14- or 16-foot lengths. $225 Value!   Audiobook.

$125

One-Year Subscription to Vaulter Magazine 

Vaulter Magazine captures the awe-inspiring world of pole-vaulting with timely feature articles, coaching advice, and stunning photographs. Including high school, college, professional, and masters competitors, this is the sport's premier publication. $155 Value! (Limit 1). Audiobook.


$150 [CLAIMED!]

Private Lesson from Coach Joe Dial, Tulsa, Oklahoma

Experience an inspiring two-hour private session at Dial Athletics with one of the world's great coaches. An American sports icon, Joe Dial was the first high school vaulter in history to clear 18 feet, and the first college vaulter to clear 19 feet. From beginner to elite, this former world-record holder has helped countless vaulters improve by leaps and bounds. A great gift idea! (Limit 1). Audiobook.

$200

Creativity Workshop with Grant Overstake, Wichita, Kansas

Unleash your inner artist through an inspiring Creativity Workshop led by facilitator Grant Overstake. This 13-week (32-hour) series begins in June and will meet Sunday afternoons in Wichita, Kan. $300 Value! (Limit 1). Audiobook.

$200

Fuzion Athletics Summer Sessions, St. Paul, Minnesota

Fuzion Athletics provides the best resources for beginner to elite vaulters, including year-round camps and training facilities, pole rentals, and traveling opportunities. One dozen 2-hour Summer Practice Sessions with Coaching from June through August, in St. Paul, Minnesota. $300 value! (Limit 1). Audiobook.

$250

Raise the Bar Pole Vault Camp, Reno, Nevada

Raise the Bar Pole Vault Camp is the perfect place to learn to pole-vault. Coach Randy Bryant has coached many young vaulters up and over the moon, including Makayla Linebarger, current US Junior Olympic Champ and national-record holder (Under 14). All lessons include technique drills, and safety is a first priority. If you want to learn to pole-vault or continue to improve, Raise The Bar is the place for you. 3-Day Summer Camp, June 24-26. $275 Value! (Limit 1). Audiobook. 

$225 [CLAIMED!]

Tailwind Pole Vault Camp, Jamestown, Kansas

Coach Mark (Doc) Breault has put more than 160 pole-vaulters on the award's stand at the Kansas State HS Championships. Over 90 percent of all vaulters soar to personal records at Tailwind Pole Vault Camps. A fun place to learn the sport, Tailwind is the inspirational home of Maggie Vaults Over the Moon. 2-Day Summer Camp (Meals and Snacks). ($250 Value! Limit 1.) Follow-up training sessions are free! Audiobook.


$300

TexasPoleVault Camps at Elitz Sports, Fort Worth, Texas

TexasPoleVault has a rich history of success in the Lone Star State for developing champions. It's the home of the new national HS indoor record holder, Desiree Freier! Whether you're a first-time vaulter or a high-flier in the sport, TexasPoleVault Camps have everything you need to soar.

3-Day Summer Camp w/Meals and Lodging. Six start dates from June 9th to Aug. 15Th, 2014. $325 Value! (Limit 2). Audiobook.

$375

Rusty Shealy Pole Vault Camp, Columbia, South Carolina

Rusty Shealy Pole Vault Camps are the place for vaulters who want to be the best they can be. Coach Shealy's camps are a great place for new vaulters to get off to the best possible start. Experienced vaulters will be amazed at the difference slight adjustments can make with great coaching. Attend this camp to find out why Coach Shealy is referred to as… “The Unfair Advantage!” 3-Day Summer Camp w/Meals and Lodging. Multiple start dates in June and July. $425 Value! (Limit 5). Audiobook.

$400

Fuzion Athletics Pole Vault Sessions, Shelbyville, Kentucky

Fuzion Athletics provides the best resources for beginner to elite vaulters, including year-round camps and training facilities, pole rentals, and traveling opportunities. Its new facility in Shelbyville brings coaching expertise and training opportunities to the Bluegrass State as well as the southern parts of Illinois, Indiana, and Ohio.

Fuzion Athletics PreState Sessions. One dozen 2-hour PreState Practice Sessions with Coaching, from now through June 1st, at our Kentucky facilities. $480 value! (Limit 1). Audiobook.

One dozen 2-hour Summer Practice Sessions with Coaching from June 1st through August 15th , Shelbyville, Kentucky. $480 value! (Limit 1). Audiobook.


$400 [2 CLAIMED!]

Maggie's Mean Green Skypole from Gill Athletics and More!

Gill Athletics, the world's largest track and field equipment manufacturer, is proud to be the Grand Prize Sponsor of Maggie's Audiobook Campaign. The Grand Prize package includes a custom-made Mean Green Skypole, like Maggie used to vault over the moon! In addition, you'll get an awesome pole carry bag made of heavy duty polyester for extra long life. And, you'll get a roll of the awesome new Ninja Elite Vaulting Grip Tape designed with thousands of gripping fingers that offer the ability to grip lighter and hold tighter, even in wet and oily conditions. Gill Athletics is The Official Equipment Supplier of USA Track & Field. Up to $650 value! (Limit 2). Audiobook. Maggie banner!

THANKS FOR SUPPORTING MAGGIE'S AUDIOBOOK CAMPAIGN!
*Indiegogo prohibits refunds on donations collected on this site, but clubs will issue rain checks due to injury, scheduling conflicts, etc. You may sell your slot at the discounted price, if needed.
story_txt:
THANK YOU!
"I want to personally thank everyone who is a contributor to the Maggie Vaults Over the Moon audiobook campaign. I am so honored to be a part of this effort, and moved by the support of the project. Whether you contribute $5 or $500, you're a true partner in this labor of love." -- Tavia Gilbert


"Maggie on audiobook is going to be awesome thanks to all of you who stepped up with pledges! And thanks our great sponsors, Dial Athletics, Phillip Carrero, Fuzion Athletics, Gill Athletics, Raise the Bar Pole Vault Club, Shealy Athletics, Tailwind Pole Vault Club, and TexasPoleVault at Elite Sportz! Because of your generous support, Maggie's story will be heard!" -- Grant Overstake
About 'Maggie Vaults Over the Moon'Maggie Steele is a gritty farm girl from tiny Grain Valley, Kansas who pours her broken heart into the daring sport of pole-vaulting. Her determined struggle to triumph over gravity is a compelling quest that everyone can relate to. 
“I myself experienced loss when I was a young girl. Sports were my outlet and helped me through some of the hardest times of my
life. This book captured me cover to cover. I highly recommend Maggie Vaults Over the Moon.” -- Becky Holliday, US Olympic Pole-Vaulter. 



Reviewers are cheering for Maggie!Family Friendly Listening"Maggie has a tragedy without being gruesome, a love story that is innocent, and competitors that exhibit true sportsmanship. It is truly 
refreshing. The world needs more Maggies!" -- Jolene Frook, Sports Mom
Journey to the Heartland“Overstake gets everything right about Kansas. It's sweet to read about a land I know so well.” -- Diane Wahto, Kansas Poet 
Awaken hopes and dreams“The positive influence this book can have on young athletes is invaluable. I am thrilled to have my athletes read it and be energized by its positive message.”  -- Erica Bartolina, US Olympian, Coach of Champions
Meet Tavia GilbertTavia Gilbert (SAG-AFTRA) is an award-winning narrator with more than 250 audiobooks under her belt. Classically trained in voice and theater, Tavia attended the University of Washington and earned her Bachelor of Fine Arts in Original Works in Acting from Cornish College of the Arts and an MFA in Creative Non-Fiction from Vermont College of Fine Arts. Also a producer, Tavia has a clear understanding of the business side of her world. Her clients hire her again and again, recognizing her exceptional work and the advantage they have in someone with both a creative and business mind. Tavia resides in Brooklyn, New York."My intention is to manifest opportunities to develop deep relationships and tell stories that enlighten, uplift, inspire, entertain, move, comfort, motivate, educate, and encourage transformation." -- Tavia GilbertMeet Grant OverstakeGrant Overstake studied journalism at the University of Kansas and was a decathlete on the KU track team. He began sports writing at age 18 at The Wichita Eagle and later wrote for The Miami Herald. Grant returned home to edit rural newspapers, becoming one of the Sunflower State's most honored journalists. His premier novel, Maggie Vaults Over the Moon, was released in 2012 by his indie-publishing company, Go Team! Enterprises. His second novel, The Things We Put Away, will appear in 2014. In addition to writing and publishing, Grant facilitates creativity workshops. Grant and his wife, Claire, reside in Wichita. 
“My vision is that
after hearing Tavia tell Maggie's story, a youngster will say: ‘If Maggie can do it, then why can't I? Today, I’m going to try!’” -- Grant OverstakePick a support level, Enjoy your reward!$10Join Maggie's Fan Club.Thank you! Thank you!$25Maggie Vaults Over the Moon on Audiobook Share the journey as storyteller Tavia Gilbert reads Maggie. Digital download.$50Cover Art by Phillip CarreroEnjoy a high-quality poster of Maggie's new cover by Australia's Phillip Carrero, the world's foremost painter of this beautiful sport. Audiobook.$125 [CLAIMED!]
Vault Pole Bag from Fuzion AthleticsThis is truly a pole vaulter's pole bag, designed and made in the US by vaulters who've tried the other
bags that just don't work. These rugged vinyl bags are about 8 inches
in diameter and large enough to fit around a 6-inch corrugated tube.
Choice of 14- or 16-foot lengths. $225 Value!   Audiobook.
$125 One-Year Subscription to Vaulter Magazine   Vaulter Magazine
 captures the awe-inspiring world of pole-vaulting with timely feature 
articles, coaching advice, and stunning photographs. Including high 
school, college, professional, and masters competitors, this is the sport's premier publication. $155 Value! (Limit 1). Audiobook.$150 [CLAIMED!]
Private Lesson from Coach Joe Dial, Tulsa, Oklahoma 
Experience an inspiring
two-hour private session at Dial Athletics with one of the world's great coaches. An American sports icon, Joe Dial was the first
high school vaulter in history to clear 18 feet, and the first
college vaulter to clear 19 feet. From beginner to elite, this
former world-record holder has helped countless vaulters improve by leaps and bounds. A great gift idea!  (Limit 1). Audiobook.$200Creativity Workshop with Grant Overstake, Wichita, KansasUnleash your inner artist through an inspiring Creativity Workshop led by facilitator Grant Overstake. This 13-week (32-hour) series begins in June and will meet Sunday afternoons in Wichita, Kan. $300 Value! (Limit 1). Audiobook.$200

story:
Short Summary

McGill Improv is an improvised comedy club out of McGill University dedicated to providing improv instruction to fellow university students, and to members of the greater Montreal Community. 

We have recently been provided the opportunity to perform in the Del Close Improv Marathon at Upright Citizen's Brigade Theatre in New York City. Del Close was an improv pioneer who taught some pretty cool folks (like Amy Poehler) how to improvise. In Short, no Del=No Amy. Imagine that world. I know that I don't want to!

In his honor, Upright Citizen's Brigade Theatre in New York runs an annual improv marathon. For 72 hours straight, there is a constant stream of 15-60 minute improv shows at each one of the UCB theatres in New York. We have one of those slots. Some really incredible people are going to be performing in this, from writers at Late Nite to Saturday Night Live Cast-members. 

McGill Improv has never had an opportunity this substantial. 1500 groups applied to perform and only 500 of those were accepted! We are so excited to have a chance to perform  internationally (at a festival with comedians we respect, nonetheless). 

To get there, we need to transport 5 improvisors across 600km of land and sea . We want to get there by any means possible. I mean, we are comedy fans. We have seen "Plans,Trains and Automobiles". It looked fun. 

What We Need

We are looking for money to send performers to New York, and put them up in a hotel once they get there.

$5: We can walk and sleep on the sidewalk! This will give us enough money to buy bandaids and a tarp, and to call our moms and tell them that we are alive. They will probably cry a lot. 

$10: We can take all share a cab to the highway to walk. Our moms will call us and ask us to come home for good. 

$500: We have enough money to send our performers by overnight bus. Our moms will start a phone tree with each other, but probably won't have to use it. 

$600: We will have enough money for overnight bus and for some coaching. Our moms will be so proud. Maybe they can bring us some orange slices. 

$650: We will have enough money for an overnight bus, coaching and team t-shirts. Our moms will think we're pretty. 

$2500: We can fly! Our moms will be so happy, but a little suspicious that we might end up sleeping outside. 

$2650: We have enough money for flights, coaching, and team t-shirts. Our moms will tell us that they are proud and that we look pretty while they fret about sleeping arrangements. 

$3500: We have enough money to safely stay in a hotel, fly, have coaching, and team t-shirts! Our moms will be so happy! They might actually be a bit worried that we are having too much fun.

story:
Since its inception in 1997, PraiseTEAM has grown from our original 9 dancers into a large company training over two hundred performers aged 5 years and older. For 17 years we have trained close to a thousand young people in different forms of dance whether it be ballet, hip hop, jazz, tap, contemporary or musical theatre, and have recently expanded by offering voice, music and acting lessons. Competitively, PraiseTEAM has won over 100 local and international awards, including podium finishes at Hip Hop International in Las Vegas.

We give our time and talent for worthy causes, and we involve ourselves in a number of outreach programs, charitable works, services in the parish, and local and international events. These include can drives, fundraising events, performing at local events and youth conferences, and raising funds to build the PraiseTEAM Learning Centre for underprivileged children in Nueva Ecija, Philippines. We ensure that our students get involved in good works and service.

We are part of the Youth Minstry of the Salesians of Don Bosco in the Our Lady of Good Counsel Church. The Salesians have supported our arts ministry in every way they can, particularly by making the space available for us to work in and nourishing us through their spiritual guidance. We are truly grateful for their generosity through the years, but we believe it is time for us to make room in the space which we were graciously given in order for us to keep growing and to continue our mission, and to allow a new family to be born into our community at Don Bosco Youth Center!

  • A Safe Place of Expression - For our students to share their talents and spread positive messages through the performing arts. We strive to make a difference in the lives of our performers by ministering to them and honing their skills, talents and passion for the arts. We welcome everyone and have granted scholarships to those who are strongly talented and to those with financial concerns. Many of our students now work professionally and have become PraiseTEAM teachers themselves!
  • Year End Productions - To showcase the hard work and dedication of our performers. We rehearse together as a company, inspiring each other and strengthening our bond as a family. At the same time, part of the proceeds is and will continue to be donated to help build homes in 3rd world countries, particularly through Gawad Kalinga and ANCOP International, and used for grant scholarships and bursaries to deserving and financially struggling students.
  • Competitions - To help students develop self confidence, discipline, perseverance to teach them the value of hard work and striving to be the best you can be.
  • Community - To get our students involved in the community, either indirectly through workshops, fundraisers, and can drives, or directly, such as through involvement in the Agape ministry serving food, singing Christmas carols to the homeless, or performing at various community events.

  • Don Bosco is a Youth Centre with many events; often we have to relocate and find another venue to rehearse at. Sometimes, it results to rehearsing outside!
  • We have mirrors on wheels that we roll out of a small office. In transport, they break. Often.
  • Sometimes there are 3 to 4 classes going on at the same time with no walls to cover the sounds of each class, making it very hard for the students to hear their instructor and focus on their lesson.
  • Speakers are broken due to teachers maximizing the volume in order for their class to hear the music above the other classes'.
  • We need a place to focus on our mission and our passion.
  • We have been focusing on finding others a home and now it is time for us to have a home of our own to accommodate our rapidly growing community!

    

  • Space - A space to call our own, with separate rooms for different classes, an office space for our admin, and even a music room! Oh, and a schedule that won't be interrupted by various events so that we never have to practice outside again.
  • Mirrors - Floor to ceiling mirrors that are attached to the wall and not to wheels, both for safety reasons and so that we don't have to spend time rolling them in and out before and after rehearsals.
  • Floors - Proper sprung flooring to be installed for our dancers! We currently dance on a rubber gym floor, and tap on a wooden stage -- not good for our dancer's joints!
  • Sound System - A proper sound system in each classroom that isn't a portable speaker/boom box! Our current speakers are portable, fragile, and not designed to be blasted at the level we are forced to turn them to to compete with other class' music!

No donation is too small! We have all sorts of perks from social media shout outs to promotion at our Annual Year End Show, including a signed photo from the crew of your choice, a meet-up with the PraiseTEAM faculty member, and PraiseTEAM Donor swag!

Can't help monetarily? No problem! Help us by sharing our story with your friends and family!

Thank you and God bless!

Julius Abad, Scholarship Recipient

story:
About The Project

ABOUT PLAYS & PLAYERS

We are a 102 year old theater company that owns and operates a 102 year old theater nestled in a residential block just off of Rittenhouse Square, one of the oldest continually operated theaters in the United States. You can see why we are particularly unique in the title: "Plays & Players." We are not just about the plays we put on, but about the community of artists and generations of families that have come through this building. Even Kevin Bacon performed here as a child!

ABOUT P.L.A.Y.

Plays & Players has produced a full season of plays every year since our inception, but currently only offer plays for adults. It's time to change that.

Philadelphia Local Artists for Youth (P.L.A.Y.) is a brand new yearly series aimed at introducing young audiences to the power of live theater. And it's all local: a local playwright telling local stories utilizing local actors, directors, and designers. Each play is developed and workshopped throughout the summer at the theater. The inaugural work will be titled Delaware Mudtub & The Mighty Wampum, running March 13-30, and will explore mythic animals local to the area (The Great Blue Heron, The Red Fox, The Box Turtle), people once indigenous to the Delaware River (The Lenni-Lenape), and the rituals and journeys that speak across time and species.

The P.L.A.Y. program was conceived by Producing Artistic Director Daniel Student, who trained on children's theater produced in Europe and Australia. With his leadership, in collaboration with director Candace Cihocki and writer Greg Romero, Delaware Mudtub uses physical theater techniques, found object puppetry and instrumentation, and even acro-yoga as a basis for the production. At its core, P.L.A.Y. seeks to respect the artistic judgment and aesthetic of a young person, and invites them to participate in the magic of the theatrical experience. It is an interactive and alive performance.

The cast of emerging professionals ready to burst onto the Philadelphia scene include recent graduates of the University of the Arts, Erin Elizabeth Carney, Andrew Carroll, and Mary Beth Schrader, Temple University grads Heather Cole and Maria Konstantinidis, and Rowan University graduate Tyler Garamella. Inspiring local designers involved include puppet designer Leila Ghaznavi, set designer Colin McIlvaine, props designer Ben Storey, light designer Andrew Cowles, dramaturg Laurel Hostek, and assistant director Eric Wunsch.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $7102 (we are 102 years old... get it?) But no matter what we raise from you, we vow to produce this show with as much integrity and artistic quality as we can muster. We owe our audience that much.

The funds will go directly to the costs of the first production which indirectly allows us to keep our ticket costs low (as little as $10) and even offer free tickets. This allows underserved communities a chance to see the performance, and creates community alliances for the theater to seek further funding from private and public funding sources. In other words, funding us in a small way now means we can put on the kind of quality work that reaches important audiences that will propel us towards long term success with just a little push from you!

A donation of $502 makes you an independent sponsor for the production!

  • 2 tickets for our opening day of performances on March 15 and 2 additional tickets for whenever you want to use them, and a signed picture with the entire cast from opening.
  • 2 VIP tickets to our annual Honey Bee Cabaret Fundraiser in June, a wonderful highlight of local performers, silent auction items from local businesses, and more.
  • A dedicated discount code to your friends and family for $5 off tickets for the entire run.
  • A personal biography in the program book and on our website and acknowledgement as a sponsor on the postcards and posters for the play.
  • Invitation to attend the first rehearsal of the production for a behind-the-scenes glimpse and dinner with the director and writer during the rehearsal process.

A donation of $252 adopts an actor in our performance!

  • 2 tickets for our opening day of performances on March 15, and a signed picture with your cast member from opening.
  • A dedicated discount code to your friends and family for $5 off tickets for the entire opening weekend.
  • Acknowledgement as an “adopt an actor” sponsor online and in the program book for the play.
  • Invitation to attend the first rehearsal of the production for a behind-the-scenes glimpse and dinner with the actor during the rehearsal process.

A donation of $102 puts you on the P.L.A.Y. (Philadelphia Local Audiences for Youth) list!

  • 2 tickets for our opening day of performances on March 15, and a signed postcard from the cast.
  • Acknowledgement as a donor online and in the program book for the play.
  • Invitation to attend the first rehearsal of the production for a behind-the-scenes glimpse.

A donation of $62 is what it costs a family of four to see a weekend performance!

  • A signed postcard from the cast and a note telling you exactly who saw the show thanks to your donation.
  • Acknowledgement as a donor online and in the program book for the play.

A donation of $22 is what it costs two children to see a student matinee of the play

  • A note telling you exactly who saw the show thanks to your donation.
  • Acknowledgement as a donor online and in the program book for the play.

The Impact

In supporting emerging local performers working together under a keen directorial eye, telling local stories, and sparking the imaginations of local young audiences in a one-of-a-kind performance, we create a fabric of forward thinking and creativity for Philadelphians of today and tomorrow. No big deal.

This supports our new mission: A coalition of theatre artists and enthusiasts, Plays & Players strives to provide intelligent, inclusive and diverse plays that engage and entertain audiences, to invest in local talent, and to preserve its historic landmark home.

We are an evolving company that is already home to over 200 members, supports three adult professional productions a year, and is custodian to a historic theatre with two performance spaces with a Ten Year Master Plan for renovation and additions. If you live in Philadelphia, you know someone who has seen something at Plays & Players. We are one of the oldest continually operated theaters in the entire country, but we also have just hired our first Artistic Director in 2011. We have a legacy and we have a plan. Please support that.

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Come see the show! It runs March 13-30. Go to www.playsandplayers.org for tickets.
2. Utilize indiegogo's tools to pass this to friends, and if you can or can't donate, either way, tell 102 other people about it!
story_txt:
About The Project
ABOUT PLAYS & PLAYERSWe are a 102 year old theater company that owns and operates a 102 year 
old theater nestled in a residential block just off of Rittenhouse 
Square, one of the oldest continually operated theaters in the United 
States. You can see why we are particularly unique in the title: "Plays 
& Players." We are not just about the plays we put on, but about the
 community of artists and generations of families that have come through
 this building. Even Kevin Bacon performed here as a child!ABOUT P.L.A.Y.Plays & Players has produced a full season of plays every 
year since our inception, but currently only offer plays for adults. 
It's time to change that.
Philadelphia Local Artists for Youth (P.L.A.Y.) is a brand new yearly 
series aimed at introducing young audiences to the power of live 
theater. And it's all local: a local playwright telling local stories 
utilizing local actors, directors, and designers. Each play is developed
 and workshopped throughout the summer at the theater. The inaugural 
work will be titled Delaware Mudtub & The Mighty Wampum, running March 13-30,
 and will explore mythic animals local to the area (The Great Blue 
Heron, The Red Fox, The Box Turtle), people once indigenous to the 
Delaware River (The Lenni-Lenape), and the rituals and journeys that 
speak across time and species.
The P.L.A.Y. program was conceived by Producing Artistic Director Daniel
 Student, who trained on children's theater produced in Europe and 
Australia. With his leadership, in collaboration with director Candace 
Cihocki and writer Greg Romero, Delaware Mudtub uses physical theater techniques, found object 
puppetry and instrumentation, and even acro-yoga as a basis for the 
production. At its core, P.L.A.Y. seeks to respect the artistic judgment
 and aesthetic of a young person, and invites them to participate in the
 magic of the theatrical experience. It is an interactive and alive 
performance.
The cast of emerging professionals ready to burst onto the Philadelphia 
scene include recent graduates of the University of the Arts, Erin 
Elizabeth Carney, Andrew Carroll, and Mary Beth Schrader, Temple 
University grads Heather Cole and Maria Konstantinidis, and Rowan 
University graduate Tyler Garamella. Inspiring local designers involved include puppet designer Leila Ghaznavi, set designer Colin McIlvaine, props designer Ben Storey, light designer Andrew Cowles, dramaturg Laurel Hostek, and assistant director Eric Wunsch.What We Need & What You GetWe need $7102 (we are 102 years old... get it?) But no matter what we raise from you, we vow to produce this show with as much integrity and artistic quality as we can muster. We owe our audience that much.The funds will go directly to the costs of the first production which 
indirectly allows us to keep our ticket costs low (as little as $10) and
 even offer free tickets. This allows underserved communities a chance 
to see the performance, and creates community alliances for the theater 
to seek further funding from private and public funding sources. In other words, funding us in a small way now means we can put on the kind of quality work that reaches important audiences that will propel us towards long term success with just a little push from you!A donation of $502 makes you an independent sponsor for the production! 
2 tickets for our opening day of performances on March 15 and 2 additional tickets for whenever you want to use them, and a signed picture 
with the entire cast from opening.
2 VIP tickets to our annual Honey Bee Cabaret Fundraiser in June, a wonderful highlight of local performers, silent auction items from local businesses, and more.
A dedicated discount code to your friends and 
family for $5 off tickets for the entire run.

A personal biography in the program book and on our website and acknowledgement as a sponsor on the postcards and posters for the play. 

Invitation to attend the first rehearsal of the production for a behind-the-scenes glimpse and dinner with the director and writer during the rehearsal process.

A donation of $252 adopts an actor in our performance! 
2 tickets for our opening day of performances on March 15, and a signed picture with your cast member from opening.
A dedicated discount code to your friends and family for $5 off tickets for the entire opening weekend.
Acknowledgement as an “adopt an actor” sponsor online and in the program book for the play.
Invitation to attend the first rehearsal of the production for a behind-the-scenes glimpse and dinner with the actor during the rehearsal process.

A donation of $102 puts you on the P.L.A.Y. (Philadelphia Local Audiences for Youth) list!
2 tickets for our opening day of performances on March 15, and a signed postcard from the cast.

Acknowledgement as a donor online and in the program book for the play.
Invitation to attend the first rehearsal of the production for a behind-the-scenes glimpse.
A donation of $62 is what it costs a family of four to see a weekend performance!
A signed postcard from the cast and a note telling you exactly who saw the show thanks to your donation.

Acknowledgement as a donor online and in the program book for the play.

A donation of $22 is what it costs two children to see a student matinee of the play
A note telling you exactly who saw the show thanks to your donation.

Acknowledgement as a donor online and in the program book for the play.

The ImpactIn supporting emerging local performers working together under a keen directorial eye, telling local stories, and sparking the imaginations of local young audiences in a one-of-a-kind performance, we create a fabric of forward thinking and creativity for Philadelphians of today and tomorrow. No big deal.This supports our new mission: A coalition of theatre artists and enthusiasts, Plays & Players strives to provide intelligent, inclusive and diverse plays that engage and entertain audiences, to invest in local talent, and to preserve its historic landmark home.We are an evolving company that is already home to over 200 members, supports three adult professional productions a year, and is custodian to a historic theatre with two performance spaces with a Ten Year Master Plan for renovation and additions. If you live in Philadelphia, you know someone who has seen something at Plays & Players. We are one of the oldest continually operated theaters in the entire country, but we also have just hired our first Artistic Director in 2011. We have a legacy and we have a plan. Please support that. Other Ways You Can Help1. Come see the show! It runs March 13-30. Go to www.playsandplayers.org for tickets.2. Utilize indiegogo's tools to pass this to friends, and if you can or can't donate, either way, tell 102 other people about it!

story:
About Me

I am an actress, writer, director, singer, and dancer; in other words I love the arts. I've been in a number of plays and now I get to put one on thanks to the Thespis Play Festival of Manhattan.  If you love passion and creativity you will love contributing to the production of "The Boogeyman."  

It's a tale that touches issues which plague our community; the stuff nobody wants to talk about. I want to shed some light on these issues, and I feel so blessed to have a platform to do so.  To put on a great show that you won't forget... We Need Your Support!


Play Synopsis

Forgiveness is a road less traveled for Wendy, Tyrone and Leah. As they come face to face with their inner demons, they are spun into a world of isolation, darkness, and fear. Will they finally be able to rid themselves of the Boogeyman that lurks behind their pain.


What We Need & What You Get

It's expensive to put on a show and we are trying to raise 6,500 dollars by June 20, 2014 to help offset some of the cost. 

If your happy and you know it... Donate to the Cause
If you love the Theater...Donate to the Cause
If you love ME...Donate to the Cause

The show goes up July 10th, 11th, and 13th.  We have such a short window of time to prepare and need to act fast in order to put on a phenomenal show.  In order to achieve the Ultimate Theater Experience we have to have:

  • Cast and Crew
  • A Rehearsal Space
  • Props and Costumes
  • Playbills 
  • Posters for Marketing

Our community needs us and we need you.  We appreciate our contributors; and to show you just how much... we are going to shower you with THANKS and SUPER COOL gifts!!!  Make sure you check out the PERKS!!!

The Impact

The Boogeyman can be anyone or anything that haunts us throughout our life causing harm or pain. The Boogeyman can manifest in the form of drugs, abandonment issues, or abuse. The Boogeyman is often undetected because it lurks behind us in the shadows… always there and always haunting our future and our potential.

Your contributions will help me deliver a powerful message to many.  "It takes a village to raise a child....Help US Rebuild Our Village." Let's get back to community and that starts here. 

Other Ways You Can Help

No Denomination is TOO SMALL...

  • Tell your family and friends.  Help get the word out.
  • Come see the Play "The Boogeyman."

The best advertising is word of mouth and I need you to help me spread the word.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

We are Black Fox Theatre, a new Chicago company.  

A lot of Chicago theatre today exists to speak about or to a certain audience, focusing on issues such as empowering women or styles such as theatre of the absurd.  We noticed there are great works out there that don't get produced because they don't fit neatly into a niche.  

We want to do those shows and we want to do them well.

"Brothers Beckett" is our inaugural production and is a Midwest Premiere by an award-winning playwright.  Let's make it a hit!

What We Need & What You Get

While it can easily cost nearly double our funding goal to produce a show, we're asking for help with our necessities: paying rent and paying our actors.  Anything we collect above those costs will go to props, set, and marketing materials (postcards and fliers). We are also required to have insurance, though we'd still get it even if it wasn't required.  We have a thing for keeping actors safe and taking care of them if needed.  Putting on a show is expensive and in order to bring the best version of this show to the widest audience, we need your help!

Check out our Perks - we have everything from a "thank you!" up to a walk-on part in the show!  We're appreciative of any level of help.

Why Brothers Beckett? 

"Truly, Brothers Beckett would be an awesome sitcom. Anthony Conway and Maurice Demus are entirely, endearingly believable as brothers who are happiest when they're bickering over a game of backgammon." - Aimee Levitt, Chicago Reader

"Brothers Beckett" gives a voice to many people you may know (you might even be one of them!). It gives a glimpse into the lives of everyone who has struggled to grow up as they age, to everyone who has striven to balance family, love, friendship, and responsibility. We're all a little absurd as we hold onto the way things were and a little confused as we try to shape the life we want. "Brothers Beckett" brings us into that moment in Kevin and Brad Beckett's lives.
 
Cast List:
 
Brad Beckett - Anthony Conway
Kevin Beckett - Maurice Demus
Doug - Sean Gallagher
Joyce - Amanda Lipinski
Tuesday - Rachael Hancz
 
"Brothers Beckett" is a Silver Palm winner.  The show won the playwright a Carbonell nomination and a Steinberg nomination.  It was voted "Best New Play" by the Miami New Times and named one of the Top 5 shows to see.
 

"Sirois creates two well-educated and co-dependent brothers played effectively by Anthony Conway (Brad) and Maurice Demus (Kevin)...Sean Gallagher (Doug) endears with his lanky, boundary-issue buffoonery...Amanda Lipinski (Joyce) delights as the ritualistic, clean freak...Playing the uptight Yoko Ono-type, Rachael Hancz (Tuesday) is this pristine threat to breaking up this band of revelers. Hancz garners some empathy for her willingness to stay in this filthy boys’ room...[I]f you’re looking for a cute show that won’t bog you down in heaviness, Brothers Beckett could be a good summer fit." - Katy Walsh, Chicago Theater Beat

 
Florida Media News says:

“Sirois is an able representative of the growing number of brilliant, contemporary  young playwrights in our midst.  His writing skill is a rare talent.  His voice is irreverent, funny and – most of all - totally in synch with today’s generation.”

“It is rare indeed to find a humorous play which so perfectly speaks to and understands this current generation, while at the same time, so eloquently is understood by those 40-plus. Credit Sirois  -- Alliance’s resident playwright and ensemble member  --  with such an  intense yet funny presentation and an ability to present a work that resonates with  all age groups.”

The Miami Herald acclaimed:

"...Brothers Beckett is that rarity, a play that speaks resonantly to its young characters’ contemporaries while entertaining a much broader audience."
 
MiamiArtzine said:

"You have to stand up and cheer for Sirois... What could be a door slamming sit-com is anything but. It's hilarious, sure, but the quiet moments always ring true."

 

The Impact

Our playwright/director has been part of producing this and others of his shows several times in the past few years and is thrilled to be bringing "Brothers Beckett" to the great city of Chicago.  The goal for a playwright (in most cases) is to get published and having a successful Chicago run will help him do just that, making the play more accessible to companies across the country who would like to produce fun, poingnant material that's more about characters than flashy sets and effects.

The rest of the Black Fox team has loads of experience producing shows - we're actors, Artistic and Executive Directors, stage managers, marketers, designers, and just plain fun people.  We love connecting artists and audiences and have the experience to do so while handling your money well!

The Risks

We know that there are many risks with any production. As a new company we have to work extra hard to get our name out and in a city like Chicago we're competing with lots of theaters for an audience. As we seek to give voice to overlooked shows, we view our work as important (and fun!). We understand, though, that without funds to tell people about what we're doing, it doesn't matter how amazing the show is (and we really do think it's going to be brilliant), people won't know to come see it. If you help us to cover the basic costs, we can put more effort into advertising and creating a beautiful show.

Other Ways You Can Help

You know the drill here - spread the word!  Tell your friends about us and ask them to see the show with you, give fliers to their local coffee shop, pass this link on to people who might want to be part of bringing "Brothers Beckett" to Chicago!

 

Thank you!
